API#

tosclib

Template

Represents a .tosc file.

Control

Model for the Template's Control.

Root

Model for the XML root.

Property

Model for the Control's Property.

Value

Model for the Control's Values.

Osc

Model for the Control's Osc Message https://hexler.net/touchosc/manual/editor-messages-osc

Local

Model for the Control's Local Message.

Midi

Model for the Control's Midi Message https://hexler.net/touchosc/manual/editor-messages-midi

MidiValue

Model for the Midi Message's Type and its data.

MidiMessage

Model for the Midi Message's Matching https://hexler.net/touchosc/manual/editor-messages-midi#matching

Trigger

Model for Message's Trigger.

Partial

Model for Argument and Path's Partial.

Template

class tosclib.Template[source]#

Represents a .tosc file.

It will parse and unparse the data from XML to Pydantic models and back. It doesn’t deal with the structural content of the file and will keep a Root model before the first Control.

Example

t = Template(‘myfile.tosc’) msg = Midi() t.root.control[0].messages.append(msg) t.save(‘newfile.tosc’)

dumps(pretty=True)[source]#

Returns a string representation.

Returns:

XML string.

Return type:

(str)

dump(filepath, pretty=True)[source]#

Write uncompressed .xml file.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – XML file path.

save(filepath)[source]#

Write contents to a compressed file.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – File path.

class tosclib.Root[source]#

Model for the XML root. Kept for structural consistency with XML.

Control

class tosclib.Control[source]#

Model for the Template’s Control. The XML file labels a ‘control’ as ‘node’.

Access the Control’s children via index notation.

Example

child = control[0]

https://hexler.net/touchosc/manual/editor-control

dumps(indent=2, exclude={'children'}, **kwargs)[source]#
